name: activate_all_roles_on_login
description: Whether to enable automatic activation of all granted roles when users log in to the server.

name: audit_log_enabled
description: Allow to audit the log.

name: audit_log_events
description: Select the events to audit logs.

name: audit_log_exclude_users
description: The comma-separated user list whose commands will not be in the audit logs.

name: audit_log_include_users
description: The comma-separated user list whose commands will be in the audit logs. It takes higher priority if the same user name is found in audit_log_exclude_users.

name: auto_increment_increment
description: The auto_increment_increment is intended for use with source-to-source replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

name: auto_increment_offset
description: The auto_increment_offset is intended for use with source-to-source replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

name: binlog_expire_logs_seconds
description: Number of seconds to service waits before the binary log file gets purged. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/flexible-server/concepts-server-parameters#binlog_expire_logs_seconds

name: binlog_group_commit_sync_delay
description: Controls how many microseconds the binary log commit waits before synchronizing the binary log file to disk.

name: binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count
description: The maximum number of transactions to wait for before aborting the current delay as specified by binlog-group-commit-sync-delay.

name: binlog_row_image
description: For MySQL row-based replication, this variable determines how row images are written to the binary log.

name: character_set_server
description: Use charset_name as the default server character set.

name: collation_server
description: The server's default collation.

name: connect_timeout
description: The number of seconds that the mysqld server waits for a connect packet before responding with Bad handshake.

name: default_week_format
description: The default mode value to use for the WEEK() function.

name: div_precision_increment
description: Number of digits by which to increase the scale of the result of division operations.

name: eq_range_index_dive_limit
description: This variable indicates the number of equality ranges in an equality comparison condition when the optimizer should switch from using index dives to index statistics in estimating the number of qualifying rows.

name: event_scheduler
description: Indicates the status of the Event Scheduler.

name: explicit_defaults_for_timestamp
description: [Deprecated] This system variable determines whether the server enables certain nonstandard behaviors for default values and NULL-value handling in TIMESTAMP columns.

name: flush_time
description: If this is set to a nonzero value, all tables are closed every flush_time seconds to free up resources and synchronize unflushed data to disk.

name: ft_query_expansion_limit
description: The number of top matches to use for full-text searches performed using WITH QUERY EXPANSION.

name: group_concat_max_len
description: Maximum allowed result length in bytes for the GROUP_CONCAT().

name: init_connect
description: A string to be executed by the server for each client that connects.

name: innodb_adaptive_flushing
description: Specifies whether to dynamically adjust the rate of flushing dirty pages in the InnoDB buffer pool based on the workload. Adjusting the flush rate dynamically is intended to avoid bursts of I/O activity.

name: innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm
description: Defines the low water mark representing percentage of redo log capacity at which adaptive flushing is enabled.

name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index
description: Whether innodb adaptive hash indexes are enabled or disabled.

name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts
description: Partitions the adaptive hash index search system. Each index is bound to a specific partition, with each partition protected by a separate latch.

name: innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay
description: Permits InnoDB to automatically adjust the value of innodb_thread_sleep_delay up or down according to the current workload.

name: innodb_autoextend_increment
description: The increment size (in megabytes) for extending the size of an auto-extending InnoDB system tablespace file when it becomes full.

name: innodb_autoinc_lock_mode
description: The lock mode to use for generating auto-increment values.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct
description: Specifies the percentage of the most recently used pages for each buffer pool to read out and dump.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_size
description: The size in bytes of the buffer pool, the memory area where InnoDB caches table and index data.

name: innodb_change_buffer_max_size
description: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of the buffer pool. You might increase this value for a MySQL server with heavy insert, update, and delete activity, or decrease it for a MySQL server with unchanging data used for reporting.

name: innodb_change_buffering
description: Whether InnoDB performs change buffering, an optimization that delays write operations to secondary indexes so that the I/O operations can be performed sequentially.

name: innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled
description: Enables per-index compression-related statistics in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.INNODB_CMP_PER_INDEX table. Because these statistics can be expensive to gather, only enable this option on development, test, or slave instances during performance tuning related to InnoDB compressed tables.

name: innodb_commit_concurrency
description: The number of threads that can commit at the same time. A value of 0 (the default) permits any number of transactions to commit simultaneously. The value of innodb_commit_concurrency cannot be changed at runtime from zero to nonzero or vice versa. The value can be changed from one nonzero value to another.

name: innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct
description: Defines the compression failure rate threshold for a table, as a percentage, at which point MySQL begins adding padding within compressed pages to avoid expensive compression failures.

name: innodb_compression_level
description: Specifies the level of zlib compression to use for InnoDB compressed tables and indexes. A higher value lets you fit more data onto a storage device, at the expense of more CPU overhead during compression. A lower value lets you reduce CPU overhead when storage space is not critical, or you expect the data is not especially compressible.

name: innodb_compression_pad_pct_max
description: Specifies the maximum percentage that can be reserved as free space within each compressed page, allowing room to reorganize the data and modification log within the page when a compressed table or index is updated and the data might be recompressed. Only applies when innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct is set to a nonzero value, and the rate of compression failures passes the cutoff point.

name: innodb_concurrency_tickets
description: Determines the number of threads that can enter InnoDB concurrently.

name: innodb_deadlock_detect
description: This option is used to disable deadlock detection. On high concurrency systems, deadlock detection can cause a slowdown when numerous threads wait for the same lock.

name: innodb_default_row_format
description: The innodb_default_row_format option defines the default row format for InnoDB tables and user-created temporary tables.

name: innodb_fill_factor
description: InnoDB performs a bulk load when creating or rebuilding indexes.

name: innodb_ft_enable_stopword
description: Specifies that a set of stopwords is associated with an InnoDB FULLTEXT index at the time the index is created.

name: innodb_ft_max_token_size
description: Maximum character length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_min_token_size
description: Minimum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_num_word_optimize
description: Number of words to process during each OPTIMIZE TABLE operation on an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_result_cache_limit
description: The InnoDB full-text search query result cache limit (defined in bytes) per full-text search query or per thread.

name: innodb_ft_server_stopword_table
description: This option is used to specify your own InnoDB FULLTEXT index stopword list for all InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_ft_sort_pll_degree
description: Number of threads used in parallel to index and tokenize text in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index when building a search index.

name: innodb_io_capacity
description: Sets an upper limit on I/O activity performed by InnoDB background tasks, such as flushing pages from the buffer pool and merging data from the change buffer.

name: innodb_io_capacity_max
description: If flushing activity falls behind, InnoDB can flush more aggressively than the limit imposed by innodb_io_capacity. innodb_io_capacity_max defines an upper limit the number of I/O operations performed per second by InnoDB background tasks in such situations.

name: innodb_lock_wait_timeout
description: The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up.

name: innodb_log_compressed_pages
description: Specifies whether images of re-compressed pages are written to the redo log.

name: innodb_lru_scan_depth
description: A parameter that influences the algorithms and heuristics for the flush operation for the InnoDB buffer pool.

name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct
description: InnoDB tries to flush data from the buffer pool so that the percentage of dirty pages does not exceed this value.

name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm
description: Defines a low water mark representing the percentage of dirty pages at which preflushing is enabled to control the dirty page ratio.

name: innodb_max_purge_lag
description: Defines the maximum length of the purge queue. The default value of 0 indicates no limit (no delays).

name: innodb_max_purge_lag_delay
description: Specifies the maximum delay in microseconds for the delay imposed by the innodb_max_purge_lag configuration option.

name: innodb_old_blocks_pct
description: Specifies the approximate percentage of the InnoDB buffer pool used for the old block sublist.

name: innodb_old_blocks_time
description: Non-zero values protect against the buffer pool being filled by data that is referenced only for a brief period, such as during a full table scan.

name: innodb_online_alter_log_max_size
description: Specifies an upper limit on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_optimize_fulltext_only
description: Changes the way OPTIMIZE TABLE operates on InnoDB tables. Intended to be enabled temporarily, during maintenance operations for InnoDB tables with FULLTEXT indexes.

name: innodb_page_cleaners
description: The number of page cleaner threads that flush dirty pages from buffer pool instances.

name: innodb_purge_batch_size
description: Defines the number of undo log pages that purge parses and processes in one batch from the history list.

name: innodb_purge_rseg_truncate_frequency
description: Defines the frequency with which the purge system frees rollback segments in terms of the number of times that purge is invoked. Reducing this value increases the frequency with which the purge thread frees rollback segments.

name: innodb_purge_threads
description: The number of background threads devoted to the InnoDB purge operation.

name: innodb_random_read_ahead
description: Enables the random read-ahead technique for optimizing InnoDB I/O.

name: innodb_read_ahead_threshold
description: Controls the sensitivity of linear read-ahead that InnoDB uses to prefetch pages into the buffer pool.

name: innodb_read_io_threads
description: The number of I/O threads for read operations in InnoDB.

name: innodb_rollback_segments
description: Defines the number of rollback segments used by InnoDB.

name: innodb_stats_auto_recalc
description: Causes InnoDB to automatically recalculate persistent statistics after the data in a table is changed substantially.

name: innodb_stats_include_delete_marked
description: Enabled to ensure that InnoDB includes delete-marked records when calculating persistent optimizer statistics.

name: innodb_stats_method
description: How the server treats NULL values when collecting statistics about the distribution of index values for InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_stats_on_metadata
description: This option only applies when optimizer statistics are configured to be non-persistent. When innodb_stats_on_metadata is enabled, InnoDB updates non-persistent statistics when metadata statements such as SHOW TABLE STATUS or when accessing the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES or INFORMATION_SCHEMA.STATISTICS tables.

name: innodb_stats_persistent
description: Specifies whether InnoDB index statistics are persisted to disk. Otherwise, statistics may be recalculated frequently which can lead to variations in query execution plans.

name: innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages
description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.

name: innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages
description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.

name: innodb_sync_array_size
description: Defines the size of the mutex/lock wait array. Increasing the value splits the internal data structure used to coordinate threads, for higher concurrency in workloads with large numbers of waiting threads.

name: innodb_table_locks
description: The default value of innodb_table_locks is 1, which means that LOCK TABLES causes InnoDB to lock a table internally if autocommit = 0.

name: innodb_thread_concurrency
description: InnoDB tries to keep the number of operating system threads concurrently inside InnoDB less than or equal to the limit given by this variable.

name: innodb_thread_sleep_delay
description: Defines how long InnoDB threads sleep before joining the InnoDB queue, in microseconds.

name: innodb_write_io_threads
description: The number of I/O threads for write operations in InnoDB.

name: interactive_timeout
description: Number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

name: local_infile
description: This variable controls server-side LOCAL capability for LOAD DATA statements.

name: lock_wait_timeout
description: This variable specifies the timeout in seconds for attempts to acquire metadata locks.

name: log_bin_trust_function_creators
description: This variable applies when binary logging is enabled. It controls whether stored function creators can be trusted not to create stored functions that will cause unsafe events to be written to the binary log.

name: log_output
description: The destination for general query log and slow query log output.

name: log_queries_not_using_indexes
description: Logs queries that are expected to retrieve all rows to slow query log.

name: log_slow_admin_statements
description: Include slow administrative statements in the statements written to the slow query log.

name: log_slow_slave_statements
description: When the slow query log is enabled, this variable enables logging for queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute on the slave.

name: log_throttle_queries_not_using_indexes
description: Limits the number of such queries per minute that can be written to the slow query log.

name: long_query_time
description: If a query takes longer than this many seconds, the server increments the Slow_queries status variable.

name: max_allowed_packet
description: The maximum size of one packet or any generated/intermediate string, or any parameter sent by the mysql_stmt_send_long_data() C API function.

name: max_connect_errors
description: If more than this many successive connection requests from a host are interrupted without a successful connection, the server blocks that host from further connections.

name: max_connections
description: The maximum permitted number of simultaneous client connections.

name: max_digest_length
description: The maximum number of bytes available for computing normalized statement digests.

name: max_error_count
description: The maximum number of error, warning, and note messages to be stored for display by the SHOW ERRORS and SHOW WARNINGS statements.

name: max_execution_time
description: The execution timeout for SELECT statements, in milliseconds. If the value is 0, timeouts are not enabled.

name: max_join_size
description: Do not permit statements that probably need to examine more than max_join_size rows

name: max_length_for_sort_data
description: The cutoff on the size of index values that determines which filesort algorithm to use.

name: max_points_in_geometry
description: The maximum value of the points_per_circle argument to the ST_Buffer_Strategy() function.

name: max_prepared_stmt_count
description: This variable limits the total number of prepared statements in the server.

name: max_seeks_for_key
description: Limit the assumed maximum number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key.

name: max_sort_length
description: The number of bytes to use when sorting data values.

name: max_sp_recursion_depth
description: The number of times that any given stored procedure may be called recursively. The default value for this option is 0, which completely disables recursion in stored procedures.

name: max_user_connections
description: The maximum number of simultaneous connections permitted to any given MySQL user account. A value of 0 (the default) means 'no limit.'

name: max_write_lock_count
description: After this many write locks, permit some pending read lock requests to be processed in between.

name: min_examined_row_limit
description: Can be used to cause queries which examine fewer than the stated number of rows not to be logged.

name: net_buffer_length
description: Each client thread is associated with a connection buffer and result buffer. Both begin with a size given by net_buffer_length but are dynamically enlarged up to max_allowed_packet bytes as needed.

name: net_read_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for network reading action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.

name: net_retry_count
description: If a read or write on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up.

name: net_write_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for network writing action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.

name: optimizer_prune_level
description: Controls the heuristics applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space.

name: optimizer_search_depth
description: The maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer.

name: optimizer_switch
description: The value of this variable is a set of flags, each of which has a value of on or off to indicate whether the corresponding optimizer behavior is enabled or disabled.

name: parser_max_mem_size
description: The maximum amount of memory available to the parser.

name: performance_schema
description: The value of this variable is ON or OFF to indicate whether the Performance Schema is enabled.

name: preload_buffer_size
description: The size of the buffer that is allocated when preloading indexes.

name: query_store_capture_interval
description: The query store capture interval in minutes. Allows to specify the interval in which the query metrics are aggregated.

name: query_store_capture_mode
description: The query store capture mode, NONE means do not capture any statements. NOTE: If performance_schema is OFF, turning on query_store_capture_mode will turn on performance_schema and a subset of performance schema instruments required for this feature.

name: query_store_capture_utility_queries
description: Turning ON or OFF to capture all the utility queries that is executing in the system.

name: query_store_retention_period_in_days
description: The query store capture interval in minutes. Allows to specify the interval in which the query metrics are aggregated.

name: query_store_wait_sampling_capture_mode
description: The query store wait event sampling capture mode, NONE means do not capture any wait events.

name: query_store_wait_sampling_frequency
description: The query store wait event sampling frequency in seconds.

name: read_only
description: This parameter controls whetherthe server permits no client updates. When the server is read replica or server storage is full, this parameter will not take effect.

name: redirect_enabled
description: Indicate server support redirection.

name: replicate_wild_ignore_table
description: Creates a replication filter which keeps the slave thread from replicating a statement in which any table matches the given wildcard pattern. To specify more than one table to ignore, use comma-separated list.

name: server_id
description: The server ID, used in replication to give each master and slave a unique identity.

name: session_track_gtids
description: Controls whether the server returns GTIDs to the client, enabling the client to use them to track the server state.

name: session_track_schema
description: Controls whether the server tracks changes to the default schema (database) name within the current session and makes this information available to the client when changes occur.

name: session_track_state_change
description: Controls whether the server tracks changes to the state of the current session and notifies the client when state changes occur.

name: skip_show_database
description: This prevents people from using the SHOW DATABASES statement if they do not have the SHOW DATABASES privilege.

name: slave_net_timeout
description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from the master before the slave considers the connection broken, aborts the read, and tries to reconnect.

name: slow_query_log
description: Enable or disable the slow query log

name: sql_mode
description: The current server SQL mode.

name: sql_require_primary_key
description: When set, tables must be created with a primary key, and an existing primary key cannot be removed with 'ALTER TABLE'. Attempts to do so will result in an error

name: stored_program_cache
description: Sets a soft upper limit for the number of cached stored routines per connection.

name: table_definition_cache
description: The number of table definitions (from .frm files) that can be stored in the definition cache.

name: table_open_cache
description: The number of open tables for all threads.

name: thread_cache_size
description: How many threads the server should cache for reuse. The default value is 8 + (max_connections / 100), capped to a limit of 100.

name: thread_handling
description: The thread-handling model used by the server for connection threads.

name: thread_pool_batch_max_time
description: Maximum time for a thread to run continously (unit: us).

name: thread_pool_batch_wait_timeout
description: Maximum time for a thread to wait for socket ready (unit: us).

name: thread_pool_max_threads
description: The maximal number of threads in the thread pool. Only works when thread_handling=pool-of-threads.

name: thread_pool_min_threads
description: The minimal number of threads in the thread pool. Only works when thread_handling=pool-of-threads.

name: thread_stack
description: The stack size for each thread.

name: time_zone
description: The server time zone

name: transaction_alloc_block_size
description: The amount in bytes by which to increase a per-transaction memory pool which needs memory.

name: transaction_isolation
description: The default transaction isolation level.

name: transaction_prealloc_size
description: There is a per-transaction memory pool from which various transaction-related allocations take memory. The initial size of the pool in bytes is transaction_prealloc_size.

name: updatable_views_with_limit
description: This variable controls whether updates to a view can be made when the view does not contain all columns of the primary key defined in the underlying table, if the update statement contains a LIMIT clause.

name: wait_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.

name: aad_auth_only
description: Setting this to ON sets the authentication to Azure AD authentication only and disable MySQL Authentication. Configure this parameter only when Azure AD authentication is configured.

name: activate_all_roles_on_login
description: Whether to enable automatic activation of all granted roles when users log in to the server.

name: admin_address
description: The IP address on which to listen for TCP/IP connections on the administrative network interface.

name: admin_port
description: The TCP/IP port number to use for connections on the administrative network interface.

name: admin_ssl_ca
description: The admin_ssl_ca system variable is like ssl_ca, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_capath
description: The admin_ssl_capath system variable is like ssl_capath, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_cert
description: The admin_ssl_cert system variable is like ssl_cert, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_cipher
description: The admin_ssl_cipher system variable is like ssl_cipher, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_crl
description: The admin_ssl_crl system variable is like ssl_crl, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_crlpath
description: The admin_ssl_crlpath system variable is like ssl_crlpath, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_ssl_key
description: The admin_ssl_key system variable is like ssl_key, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_tls_ciphersuites
description: The admin_tls_ciphersuites system variable is like tls_ciphersuites, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: admin_tls_version
description: The admin_tls_version system variable is like tls_version, except that it applies to the administrative connection interface rather than the main connection interface.

name: archive
description: Tell the server to enable or disable archive engine.

name: audit_log_enabled
description: Allow to audit the log.

name: audit_log_events
description: Select the events to audit logs.

name: audit_log_exclude_users
description: The comma-separated user list whose commands will not be in the audit logs.

name: audit_log_include_users
description: The comma-separated user list whose commands will be in the audit logs. It takes higher priority if the same user name is found in audit_log_exclude_users.

name: audit_slow_log_enabled
description: Allow to audit the slow log.

name: auto_generate_certs
description: Controls whether the server autogenerates SSL key and certificate files in the data directory, if they do not already exist.

name: auto_increment_increment
description: The auto_increment_increment is intended for use with source-to-source replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

name: auto_increment_offset
description: The auto_increment_offset is intended for use with source-to-source replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

name: autocommit
description: The autocommit mode. If set to ON, all changes to a table take effect immediately. If set to OFF, you must use COMMIT to accept a transaction or ROLLBACK to cancel it.

name: automatic_sp_privileges
description: When this variable has a value of 1 (the default), the server automatically grants the EXECUTE and ALTER ROUTINE privileges to the creator of a stored routine, if the user cannot already execute and alter or drop the routine.

name: avoid_temporal_upgrade
description: This variable controls whether ALTER TABLE implicitly upgrades temporal columns found to be in pre-5.6.4 format.

name: azure_replication_repair_time
description: The replica repair time in minutes after the replication is broken.

name: back_log
description: The number of outstanding connection requests MySQL can have

name: big_tables
description: If enabled, the server stores all temporary tables on disk rather than in memory. This prevents most The table tbl_name is full errors for SELECT operations that require a large temporary table, but also slows down queries for which in-memory tables would suffice.

name: binlog_cache_size
description: The size of the cache to hold changes to the binary log during a transaction.

name: binlog_checksum
description: When enabled, this variable causes the master to write a checksum for each event in the binary log.

name: binlog_direct_non_transactional_updates
description: Causes updates to non-transactional engines using statement format to be written directly to binary log. This variable has no effect when the binary log format is ROW or MIXED.

name: binlog_encryption
description: Enables encryption for binary log files and relay log files on this server.

name: binlog_error_action
description: Controls what happens when the server cannot write to the binary log, which can cause the master's log to become inconsistent and replication slaves to lose synchronization.

name: binlog_expire_logs_seconds
description: Number of seconds to service waits before the binary log file gets purged. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/flexible-server/concepts-server-parameters#binlog_expire_logs_seconds

name: binlog_format
description: This variable sets the binary logging format, and can be any one of STATEMENT, ROW, or MIXED.

name: binlog_group_commit_sync_delay
description: Controls how many microseconds the binary log commit waits before synchronizing the binary log file to disk.

name: binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count
description: The maximum number of transactions to wait for before aborting the current delay as specified by binlog-group-commit-sync-delay.

name: binlog_gtid_simple_recovery
description: This variable controls how binary log files are iterated during the search for GTIDs when MySQL starts or restarts.

name: binlog_order_commits
description: If this variable is enabled (the default), transactions are committed in the same order they are written to the binary log. If disabled, transactions may be committed in parallel.

name: binlog_rotate_encryption_master_key_at_startup
description: Specifies whether or not the binary log master key is rotated at server startup.

name: binlog_row_event_max_size
description: When row-based binary logging is used, this setting is a soft limit on the maximum size of a row-based binary log event, in bytes. Where possible, rows stored in the binary log are grouped into events with a size not exceeding the value of this setting. If an event cannot be split, the maximum size can be exceeded. The value must be (or else gets rounded down to) a multiple of 256.

name: binlog_row_image
description: For MySQL row-based replication, this variable determines how row images are written to the binary log.

name: binlog_row_metadata
description: Configures the amount of table metadata added to the binary log when using row-based logging. When set to MINIMAL, the default, only metadata related to SIGNED flags, column character set and geometry types are logged. When set to FULL complete metadata for tables is logged, such as column name, ENUM or SET string values, PRIMARY KEY information, and so on.

name: binlog_row_value_options
description: When set to PARTIAL_JSON, this enables use of a space-efficient binary log format for updates that modify only a small portion of a JSON document, which causes row-based replication to write only the modified parts of the JSON document to the after-image for the update in the binary log (rather than writing the full document).

name: binlog_rows_query_log_events
description: The binlog_rows_query_log_events system variable affects row-based logging only. When enabled, it causes the MySQL Server to write informational log events such as row query log events into its binary log.

name: binlog_stmt_cache_size
description: This variable determines the size of the cache for the binary log to hold nontransactional statements issued during a transaction.

name: binlog_transaction_dependency_history_size
description: Sets an upper limit on the number of row hashes which are used for looking up the transaction that last modified a given row

name: binlog_transaction_dependency_tracking
description: The source uses to determine which transactions can be executed in parallel by the replica's multithreaded applier.

name: blackhole
description: Tell the server to enable or disable blackhole engine.

name: block_encryption_mode
description: This variable controls the block encryption mode for block-based algorithms such as AES. It affects encryption for AES_ENCRYPT() and AES_DECRYPT().

name: bulk_insert_buffer_size
description: Limits the size of the MyISAM cache tree in bytes per thread.

name: caching_sha2_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys
description: The server uses this variable to determine whether to autogenerate RSA private/public key-pair files in the data directory if they do not already exist.

name: caching_sha2_password_private_key_path
description: This variable specifies the path name of the RSA private key file for the caching_sha2_password authentication plugin.

name: caching_sha2_password_public_key_path
description: This variable specifies the path name of the RSA public key file for the caching_sha2_password authentication plugin.

name: character_set_filesystem
description: The file system character set.

name: character_set_server
description: Use charset_name as the default server character set.

name: check_proxy_users
description: If set to OFF (the default), then proxy user identity will not be mapped for authentication plugins which support mapping from grant tables. When set to ON, users associated with authentication plugins which signal proxy user mapping should be done according to GRANT PROXY privilege definition.

name: collation_server
description: The server's default collation.

name: completion_type
description: The transaction completion type.

name: concurrent_insert
description: Allows INSERT and SELECT statements to run concurrently for MyISAM tables that have no free blocks in the middle of the data file.

name: connect_timeout
description: The number of seconds that the mysqld server waits for a connect packet before responding with Bad handshake.

name: create_admin_listener_thread
description: Whether to use a dedicated listening thread for client connections on the administrative network interface.

name: cte_max_recursion_depth
description: The common table expression (CTE) maximum recursion depth.

name: default_authentication_plugin
description: The default authentication plugin.

name: default_password_lifetime
description: This variable defines the global automatic password expiration policy.

name: default_storage_engine
description: The default storage engine (table type).

name: default_table_encryption
description: Defines the default encryption setting applied to schemas and general tablespaces when they are created without specifying an ENCRYPTION clause.

name: default_tmp_storage_engine
description: The default storage engine for TEMPORARY tables.

name: default_week_format
description: The default mode value to use for the WEEK() function.

name: delay_key_write
description: It specifies how to use delayed key writes.

name: delayed_insert_limit
description: After inserting delayed_insert_limit delayed rows, the INSERT DELAYED handler thread checks whether there are any SELECT statements pending. If so, it allows them to execute before continuing to insert delayed rows.

name: delayed_insert_timeout
description: How many seconds an INSERT DELAYED handler thread should wait for INSERT statements before terminating.

name: delayed_queue_size
description: If the queue becomes full, any client that issues an INSERT DELAYED statement waits until there is room in the queue again.

name: disabled_storage_engines
description: This variable indicates which storage engines cannot be used to create tables or tablespaces.

name: disconnect_on_expired_password
description: Controls how the server handles clients with expired passwords:

name: div_precision_increment
description: Number of digits by which to increase the scale of the result of division operations.

name: end_markers_in_json
description: Whether optimizer JSON output should add end markers.

name: enforce_gtid_consistency
description: When enable, this option enforces GTID consistency by allowing execution of only those statements that can be logged in a transactionally safe manner.

name: eq_range_index_dive_limit
description: This variable indicates the number of equality ranges in an equality comparison condition when the optimizer should switch from using index dives to index statistics in estimating the number of qualifying rows.

name: event_scheduler
description: Indicates the status of the Event Scheduler. It is always OFF for a replica server to keep the replication consistency.

name: expire_logs_days
description: The number of days for automatic binary log file removal. The default is 0, which means no automatic removal. Possible removals happen at startup and when the binary log is flushed.

name: explicit_defaults_for_timestamp
description: [Deprecated] This system variable determines whether the server enables certain nonstandard behaviors for default values and NULL-value handling in TIMESTAMP columns.

name: flush
description: If ON, the server flushes (synchronizes) all changes to disk after each SQL statement. Normally, MySQL does a write of all changes to disk only after each SQL statement and lets the operating system handle the synchronizing to disk.

name: flush_time
description: If this is set to a nonzero value, all tables are closed every flush_time seconds to free up resources and synchronize unflushed data to disk.

name: ft_boolean_syntax
description: The list of operators supported by boolean full-text searches performed using IN BOOLEAN MODE.

name: ft_query_expansion_limit
description: The number of top matches to use for full-text searches performed using WITH QUERY EXPANSION.

name: general_log
description: Whether the general query log is enabled.

name: general_log_file
description: The name of the general query log file.

name: generated_random_password_length
description: The maximum number of characters permitted in random passwords generated for CREATE USER, ALTER USER, and SET PASSWORD statements.

name: group_concat_max_len
description: Maximum allowed result length in bytes for the GROUP_CONCAT().

name: group_replication_consistency
description: Controls the transaction consistency guarantee which a group provides.

name: gtid_executed_compression_period
description: Compress the mysql.gtid_executed table each time this many transactions have taken place.

name: gtid_mode
description: Indicates if global transaction identifiers (GTIDs) are used to identify transactions. You can only update it one step at a time in ascending order of modes. To keep replication consistent, you cannot update it for a master/replica server.

name: histogram_generation_max_mem_size
description: The maximum amount of memory available for generating histogram statistics.

name: host_cache_size
description: The size of the internal host cache.

name: information_schema_stats_expiry
description: Defines the period of time before cached statistics expire.

name: init_connect
description: A string to be executed by the server for each client that connects.

name: innodb_adaptive_flushing
description: Specifies whether to dynamically adjust the rate of flushing dirty pages in the InnoDB buffer pool based on the workload. Adjusting the flush rate dynamically is intended to avoid bursts of I/O activity.

name: innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm
description: Defines the low water mark representing percentage of redo log capacity at which adaptive flushing is enabled.

name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index
description: Whether innodb adaptive hash indexes are enabled or disabled.

name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts
description: Partitions the adaptive hash index search system. Each index is bound to a specific partition, with each partition protected by a separate latch.

name: innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay
description: Permits InnoDB to automatically adjust the value of innodb_thread_sleep_delay up or down according to the current workload.

name: innodb_autoextend_increment
description: The increment size (in megabytes) for extending the size of an auto-extending InnoDB system tablespace file when it becomes full.

name: innodb_autoinc_lock_mode
description: The lock mode to use for generating auto-increment values.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size
description: Defines the chunk size for online InnoDB buffer pool resizing operations.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown
description: Dump the buffer pool into a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename

name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now
description: Immediately records the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct
description: Specifies the percentage of the most recently used pages for each buffer pool to read out and dump.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_filename
description: Specifies the file that holds the list of page numbers produced by innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown or innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_in_core_file
description: Disabling the innodb_buffer_pool_in_core_file variable reduces the size of core files by excluding InnoDB buffer pool pages.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_instances
description: The number of regions that the InnoDB buffer pool is divided into

name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_abort
description: Interrupts the process of restoring InnoDB buffer pool contents triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup or innodb_buffer_pool_load_now.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup
description: Load the buffer pool from a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename

name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_now
description: Immediately warms up the InnoDB buffer pool by loading a set of data pages, without waiting for a server restart.

name: innodb_buffer_pool_size
description: The size in bytes of the buffer pool, the memory area where InnoDB caches table and index data.

name: innodb_change_buffer_max_size
description: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of the buffer pool. You might increase this value for a MySQL server with heavy insert, update, and delete activity, or decrease it for a MySQL server with unchanging data used for reporting.

name: innodb_change_buffering
description: Whether InnoDB performs change buffering, an optimization that delays write operations to secondary indexes so that the I/O operations can be performed sequentially.

name: innodb_checksum_algorithm
description: Specifies how to generate and verify the checksum stored in the disk blocks of InnoDB tablespaces.

name: innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled
description: Enables per-index compression-related statistics in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.INNODB_CMP_PER_INDEX table. Because these statistics can be expensive to gather, only enable this option on development, test, or slave instances during performance tuning related to InnoDB compressed tables.

name: innodb_commit_concurrency
description: The number of threads that can commit at the same time. A value of 0 (the default) permits any number of transactions to commit simultaneously. The value of innodb_commit_concurrency cannot be changed at runtime from zero to nonzero or vice versa. The value can be changed from one nonzero value to another.

name: innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct
description: Defines the compression failure rate threshold for a table, as a percentage, at which point MySQL begins adding padding within compressed pages to avoid expensive compression failures.

name: innodb_compression_level
description: Specifies the level of zlib compression to use for InnoDB compressed tables and indexes. A higher value lets you fit more data onto a storage device, at the expense of more CPU overhead during compression. A lower value lets you reduce CPU overhead when storage space is not critical, or you expect the data is not especially compressible.

name: innodb_compression_pad_pct_max
description: Specifies the maximum percentage that can be reserved as free space within each compressed page, allowing room to reorganize the data and modification log within the page when a compressed table or index is updated and the data might be recompressed. Only applies when innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct is set to a nonzero value, and the rate of compression failures passes the cutoff point.

name: innodb_concurrency_tickets
description: Determines the number of threads that can enter InnoDB concurrently.

name: innodb_data_file_path
description: Defines the name, size, and attributes of InnoDB system tablespace data files.

name: innodb_data_home_dir
description: The common part of the directory path for InnoDB system tablespace data files. The default value is the MySQL data directory.

name: innodb_deadlock_detect
description: This option is used to disable deadlock detection. On high concurrency systems, deadlock detection can cause a slowdown when numerous threads wait for the same lock.

name: innodb_dedicated_server
description: When this is enabled, InnoDB automatically configures the following variables: innodb_buffer_pool_size, innodb_log_file_size, innodb_log_files_in_group, innodb_flush_method.

name: innodb_default_row_format
description: The innodb_default_row_format option defines the default row format for InnoDB tables and user-created temporary tables.

name: innodb_directories
description: Defines directories to scan at startup for tablespace files.

name: innodb_disable_sort_file_cache
description: Disables the operating system file system cache for merge-sort temporary files. The effect is to open such files with the equivalent of O_DIRECT.

name: innodb_doublewrite
description: When enabled, InnoDB stores all data twice, first to the doublewrite buffer, then to the actual data files.

name: innodb_doublewrite_batch_size
description: Defines the number of doublewrite pages to write in a batch.

name: innodb_doublewrite_dir
description: Defines the directory for doublewrite files.

name: innodb_doublewrite_files
description: Defines the number of doublewrite pages to write in a batch.

name: innodb_doublewrite_pages
description: Defines the maximum number of doublewrite pages per thread for a batch write.

name: innodb_fast_shutdown
description: The InnoDB shutdown mode. If the value is 0, InnoDB does a slow shutdown, a full purge and a change buffer merge before shutting down. If the value is 1 (the default), InnoDB skips these operations at shutdown, a process known as a fast shutdown. If the value is 2, InnoDB flushes its logs and shuts down cold, as if MySQL had crashed; no committed transactions are lost, but the crash recovery operation makes the next startup take longer.

name: innodb_fatal_semaphore_wait_threshold
description: The seconds of mysql engine waiting for I/O, this threshold timeout will result in mysql engine crash.

name: innodb_file_per_table
description: InnoDB stores the data and indexes for each newly created table in a separate .ibd file instead of the system tablespace. It cannot be updated any more for a master/replica server to keep the replication consistency.

name: innodb_fill_factor
description: InnoDB performs a bulk load when creating or rebuilding indexes.

name: innodb_flush_log_at_timeout
description: Write and flush the logs every N seconds. This setting has an effect only when innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit has a value of 2.

name: innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit
description: Controls the balance between strict ACID compliance for commit operations and higher performance that is possible when commit-related I/O operations are rearranged and done in batches.

name: innodb_flush_method
description: Defines the method used to flush data to InnoDB data files and log files, which can affect I/O throughput.

name: innodb_flush_neighbors
description: Specifies whether flushing a page from the InnoDB buffer pool also flushes other dirty pages in the same extent.

name: innodb_flush_sync
description: Causes the innodb_io_capacity setting to be ignored for bursts of I/O activity that occur at checkpoints.

name: innodb_flushing_avg_loops
description: Number of iterations for which InnoDB keeps the previously calculated snapshot of the flushing state, controlling how quickly adaptive flushing responds to changing workloads.

name: innodb_force_load_corrupted
description: Permits InnoDB to load tables at startup that are marked as corrupted. Use only during troubleshooting, to recover data that is otherwise inaccessible.

name: innodb_force_recovery
description: The crash recovery mode, typically only changed in serious troubleshooting situations.

name: innodb_fsync_threshold
description: The value of this variable determines how often InnoDB calls fsync when creating a new file. Default is zero which would make InnoDB flush the entire file at once before closing it.

name: innodb_ft_cache_size
description: The memory allocated, in bytes, for the InnoDB FULLTEXT search index cache, which holds a parsed document in memory while creating an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_enable_diag_print
description: Whether to enable additional full-text search (FTS) diagnostic output. This option is primarily intended for advanced FTS debugging and will not be of interest to most users. Output is printed to the error log.

name: innodb_ft_enable_stopword
description: Specifies that a set of stopwords is associated with an InnoDB FULLTEXT index at the time the index is created.

name: innodb_ft_max_token_size
description: Maximum character length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_min_token_size
description: Minimum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_num_word_optimize
description: Number of words to process during each OPTIMIZE TABLE operation on an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.

name: innodb_ft_result_cache_limit
description: The InnoDB full-text search query result cache limit (defined in bytes) per full-text search query or per thread.

name: innodb_ft_server_stopword_table
description: This option is used to specify your own InnoDB FULLTEXT index stopword list for all InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_ft_sort_pll_degree
description: Number of threads used in parallel to index and tokenize text in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index when building a search index.

name: innodb_ft_total_cache_size
description: The total memory allocated, in bytes, for the InnoDB full-text search index cache for all tables.

name: innodb_ft_user_stopword_table
description: This option is used to specify your own InnoDB FULLTEXT index stopword list on a specific table.

name: innodb_idle_flush_pct
description: Limits page flushing when InnoDB is idle. The innodb_idle_flush_pct value is a percentage of the innodb_io_capacity setting, which defines the number of I/O operations per second available to InnoDB.

name: innodb_io_capacity
description: Sets an upper limit on I/O activity performed by InnoDB background tasks, such as flushing pages from the buffer pool and merging data from the change buffer.

name: innodb_io_capacity_max
description: If flushing activity falls behind, InnoDB can flush more aggressively than the limit imposed by innodb_io_capacity. innodb_io_capacity_max defines an upper limit the number of I/O operations performed per second by InnoDB background tasks in such situations.

name: innodb_lock_wait_timeout
description: The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up.

name: innodb_log_buffer_size
description: The size in bytes of the buffer that InnoDB uses to write to the log files on disk.

name: innodb_log_checksums
description: Enables or disables checksums for redo log pages.

name: innodb_log_compressed_pages
description: Specifies whether images of re-compressed pages are written to the redo log.

name: innodb_log_file_size
description: The size in bytes of each log file in a log group.

name: innodb_log_files_in_group
description: The number of log files in the log group. InnoDB writes to the files in a circular fashion. The default (and recommended) value is 2.

name: innodb_log_spin_cpu_abs_lwm
description: Defines the minimum amount of CPU usage below which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.

name: innodb_log_spin_cpu_pct_hwm
description: Defines the maximum amount of CPU usage above which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.

name: innodb_log_wait_for_flush_spin_hwm
description: Defines the maximum average log flush time beyond which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.

name: innodb_log_write_ahead_size
description: The write-ahead block size for the redo log, in bytes.

name: innodb_lru_scan_depth
description: A parameter that influences the algorithms and heuristics for the flush operation for the InnoDB buffer pool.

name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct
description: InnoDB tries to flush data from the buffer pool so that the percentage of dirty pages does not exceed this value.

name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm
description: Defines a low water mark representing the percentage of dirty pages at which preflushing is enabled to control the dirty page ratio.

name: innodb_max_purge_lag
description: Defines the maximum length of the purge queue. The default value of 0 indicates no limit (no delays).

name: innodb_max_purge_lag_delay
description: Specifies the maximum delay in microseconds for the delay imposed by the innodb_max_purge_lag configuration option.

name: innodb_max_undo_log_size
description: Defines a threshold size for undo tablespaces.

name: innodb_monitor_disable
description: Disables InnoDB metrics counters. Counter data may be queried using the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.INNODB_METRICS table.

name: innodb_monitor_enable
description: Enables InnoDB metrics counters.

name: innodb_monitor_reset
description: Resets the count value for InnoDB metrics counters to zero.

name: innodb_monitor_reset_all
description: Resets all values (minimum, maximum, and so on) for InnoDB metrics counters.

name: innodb_numa_interleave
description: Enables the NUMA interleave memory policy for allocation of the InnoDB buffer pool. When innodb_numa_interleave is enabled, the NUMA memory policy is set to MPOL_INTERLEAVE for the mysqld process. After the InnoDB buffer pool is allocated, the NUMA memory policy is set back to MPOL_DEFAULT.

name: innodb_old_blocks_pct
description: Specifies the approximate percentage of the InnoDB buffer pool used for the old block sublist.

name: innodb_old_blocks_time
description: Non-zero values protect against the buffer pool being filled by data that is referenced only for a brief period, such as during a full table scan.

name: innodb_online_alter_log_max_size
description: Specifies an upper limit on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_open_files
description: This configuration option is only relevant if you use multiple InnoDB tablespaces. It specifies the maximum number of .ibd files that MySQL can keep open at one time.

name: innodb_optimize_fulltext_only
description: Changes the way OPTIMIZE TABLE operates on InnoDB tables. Intended to be enabled temporarily, during maintenance operations for InnoDB tables with FULLTEXT indexes.

name: innodb_page_cleaners
description: The number of page cleaner threads that flush dirty pages from buffer pool instances.

name: innodb_page_size
description: Specifies the page size for all InnoDB tablespaces in a MySQL instance.

name: innodb_parallel_read_threads
description: Defines the number of threads that can be used for parallel clustered index reads.

name: innodb_print_all_deadlocks
description: When this option is enabled, information about all deadlocks in InnoDB user transactions is recorded in the mysqld error log.

name: innodb_print_ddl_logs
description: Enabling this option causes MySQL to write DDL logs to stderr.

name: innodb_purge_batch_size
description: Defines the number of undo log pages that purge parses and processes in one batch from the history list.

name: innodb_purge_rseg_truncate_frequency
description: Defines the frequency with which the purge system frees rollback segments in terms of the number of times that purge is invoked. Reducing this value increases the frequency with which the purge thread frees rollback segments.

name: innodb_purge_threads
description: The number of background threads devoted to the InnoDB purge operation.

name: innodb_random_read_ahead
description: Enables the random read-ahead technique for optimizing InnoDB I/O.

name: innodb_read_ahead_threshold
description: Controls the sensitivity of linear read-ahead that InnoDB uses to prefetch pages into the buffer pool.

name: innodb_read_io_threads
description: The number of I/O threads for read operations in InnoDB.

name: innodb_read_only
description: Starts InnoDB in read-only mode.

name: innodb_redo_log_archive_dirs
description: Defines labeled directories where redo log archive files can be created. You can define multiple labeled directories in a semicolon-separated list.

name: innodb_redo_log_encrypt
description: Controls encryption of redo log data for tables encrypted using the InnoDB data-at-rest encryption feature. Encryption of redo log data is disabled by default.

name: innodb_replication_delay
description: The replication thread delay in milliseconds on a slave server if innodb_thread_concurrency is reached.

name: innodb_rollback_on_timeout
description: InnoDB rolls back only the last statement on a transaction timeout by default. If --innodb_rollback_on_timeout is specified, a transaction timeout causes InnoDB to abort and roll back the entire transaction.

name: innodb_rollback_segments
description: Defines the number of rollback segments used by InnoDB.

name: innodb_sort_buffer_size
description: Specifies the sizes of several buffers used for sorting data during creation of an InnoDB index.

name: innodb_spin_wait_delay
description: The maximum delay between polls for a spin lock.

name: innodb_spin_wait_pause_multiplier
description: Defines a multiplier value used to determine the number of PAUSE instructions in spin-wait loops that occur when a thread waits to acquire a mutex or rw-lock.

name: innodb_stats_auto_recalc
description: Causes InnoDB to automatically recalculate persistent statistics after the data in a table is changed substantially.

name: innodb_stats_include_delete_marked
description: Enabled to ensure that InnoDB includes delete-marked records when calculating persistent optimizer statistics.

name: innodb_stats_method
description: How the server treats NULL values when collecting statistics about the distribution of index values for InnoDB tables.

name: innodb_stats_on_metadata
description: This option only applies when optimizer statistics are configured to be non-persistent. When innodb_stats_on_metadata is enabled, InnoDB updates non-persistent statistics when metadata statements such as SHOW TABLE STATUS or when accessing the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES or INFORMATION_SCHEMA.STATISTICS tables.

name: innodb_stats_persistent
description: Specifies whether InnoDB index statistics are persisted to disk. Otherwise, statistics may be recalculated frequently which can lead to variations in query execution plans.

name: innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages
description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.

name: innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages
description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.

name: innodb_status_output
description: Enables or disables periodic output for the standard InnoDB Monitor.

name: innodb_status_output_locks
description: Enables or disables the InnoDB Lock Monitor.

name: innodb_strict_mode
description: When innodb_strict_mode is enabled, InnoDB raises error conditions in certain cases (CREATE TABLE/INDEX)and performs row size check during inserts/updates. When disabled, InnoDB issues a warning and processes the specified statement. Disabling innodb_strict_mode is not recommended and can lead to truncated records in the table or table/index created with unintended characteristics.

name: innodb_sync_array_size
description: Defines the size of the mutex/lock wait array. Increasing the value splits the internal data structure used to coordinate threads, for higher concurrency in workloads with large numbers of waiting threads.

name: innodb_sync_spin_loops
description: The number of times a thread waits for an InnoDB mutex to be freed before the thread is suspended.

name: innodb_table_locks
description: The default value of innodb_table_locks is 1, which means that LOCK TABLES causes InnoDB to lock a table internally if autocommit = 0.

name: innodb_temp_data_file_path
description: Specifies the path, file name, and file size for InnoDB temporary tablespace data files.

name: innodb_temp_tablespaces_dir
description: Defines the location where InnoDB creates a pool of session temporary tablespaces at startup.

name: innodb_thread_concurrency
description: InnoDB tries to keep the number of operating system threads concurrently inside InnoDB less than or equal to the limit given by this variable.

name: innodb_thread_sleep_delay
description: Defines how long InnoDB threads sleep before joining the InnoDB queue, in microseconds.

name: innodb_tmpdir
description: Used to define an alternate directory for temporary sort files created during online ALTER TABLE operations that rebuild the table.

name: innodb_undo_directory
description: The path where InnoDB creates undo tablespaces.

name: innodb_undo_log_encrypt
description: Controls encryption of undo log data for tables encrypted using the InnoDB data-at-rest encryption feature. Only applies to undo logs that reside in separate undo tablespaces.

name: innodb_undo_log_truncate
description: When enabled, undo tablespaces that exceed the threshold value defined by innodb_max_undo_log_size are marked for truncation.

name: innodb_undo_tablespaces
description: The number of tablespace files that the undo logs are divided between, when you use a non-zero innodb_undo_logs setting.

name: innodb_use_native_aio
description: Controls whether or not MySQL uses Linux native asynchronous IO.

name: innodb_validate_tablespace_paths
description: Controls tablespace file path validation. At startup, InnoDB validates the paths of known tablespace files against tablespace file paths stored in the data dictionary in case tablespace files have been moved to a different location. The innodb_validate_tablespace_paths variable permits disabling tablespace path validation. This feature is intended for environments where tablespaces files are not moved. Disabling path validation improves startup time on systems with a large number of tablespace files.

name: innodb_write_io_threads
description: The number of I/O threads for write operations in InnoDB.

name: interactive_timeout
description: Number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

name: internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine
description: The storage engine for in-memory internal temporary tables.

name: join_buffer_size
description: The minimum size of the buffer that is used for plain index scans, range index scans, and joins that do not use indexes and thus perform full table scans.

name: keep_files_on_create
description: Suppress behavior to overwrite MyISAM file created in DATA DIRECTORY or INDEX DIRECTORY.

name: key_buffer_size
description: Increase the buffer size to get better index handling used for index blocks (for all reads and multiple writes).

name: key_cache_age_threshold
description: Controls the demotion of buffers from the hot sub-chain of a key cache to the warm sub-chain. Lower values cause demotion to happen more quickly.

name: key_cache_block_size
description: Size in bytes of blocks in the key cache.

name: key_cache_division_limit
description: The division point between the hot and warm sub-chains of the key cache buffer chain. The value is the percentage of the buffer chain to use for the warm sub-chain.

name: large_pages
description: Whether large page support is enabled.

name: lc_time_names
description: This variable specifies the locale that controls the language used to display day and month names and abbreviations.

name: local_infile
description: This variable controls server-side LOCAL capability for LOAD DATA statements.

name: lock_wait_timeout
description: This variable specifies the timeout in seconds for attempts to acquire metadata locks.

name: log_bin
description: Whether binlog is enabled or not. When set to ON, it will be replaced with binlog folder /app/work/binlogs. Otherwise, it will not be introduced in my.ini.

name: log_bin_trust_function_creators
description: This variable applies when binary logging is enabled. It controls whether stored function creators can be trusted not to create stored functions that will cause unsafe events to be written to the binary log. It cannot be updated any more for a master/replica server to keep the replication consistency.

name: log_bin_use_v1_row_events
description: Whether MySQL writes binary log events using a Version 1 or Version 2 logging events

name: log_error_services
description: The components to enable for error logging.

name: log_error_suppression_list
description: Applies to events intended for the error log and specifies which events to suppress when they occur with a priority of WARNING or INFORMATION.

name: log_error_verbosity
description: The verbosity for handling events intended for the error log. 1: Error messages, 2: Error and warning messages, 3: Error, warning, and note messages

name: log_output
description: The destination for general query log and slow query log output.

name: log_queries_not_using_indexes
description: Logs queries that are expected to retrieve all rows to slow query log.

name: log_raw
description: Passwords in certain statements written to the general query log, slow query log, and binary log are rewritten by the server not to occur literally in plain text. Password rewriting can be suppressed for the general query log by starting the server with the --log-raw option. This option may be useful for diagnostic purposes, to see the exact text of statements as received by the server, but for security reasons is not recommended for production use.

name: log_slave_updates
description: Normally, a slave does not write to its own binary log any updates that are received from a master server. This option causes the slave to write the updates performed by its SQL thread to its own binary log.

name: log_slow_admin_statements
description: Include slow administrative statements in the statements written to the slow query log.

name: log_slow_extra
description: If the slow query log is enabled and the output destination includes FILE, the server writes additional fields to log file lines that provide information about slow statements.

name: log_slow_slave_statements
description: When the slow query log is enabled, this variable enables logging for queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute on the slave.

name: log_statements_unsafe_for_binlog
description: If error 1592 is encountered, controls whether the generated warnings are added to the error log or not.

name: log_throttle_queries_not_using_indexes
description: Limits the number of such queries per minute that can be written to the slow query log.

name: log_timestamps
description: This variable controls the timestamp time zone of error log messages, and of general query log and slow query log messages written to files.

name: long_query_time
description: If a query takes longer than this many seconds, the server increments the Slow_queries status variable.

name: low_priority_updates
description: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and LOCK TABLE WRITE wait until no pending SELECT. Affects only storage engines that use only table-level locking (MyISAM, MEMORY, MERGE).

name: lower_case_table_names
description: If set to 0, table names are stored as specified and comparisons are case-sensitive. If set to 1, table names are stored in lowercase on disk and comparisons are not case sensitive.

name: mandatory_roles
description: Roles the server should treat as mandatory. In effect, these roles are automatically granted to every user, although setting mandatory_roles does not actually change any user accounts, and the granted roles are not visible in the mysql.role_edges system table.

name: master_info_repository
description: The setting of this variable determines whether the slave logs master status and connection information to a FILE (master.info), or to a TABLE (mysql.slave_master_info).

name: master_verify_checksum
description: Enabling this variable causes the master to examine checksums when reading from the binary log.

name: max_allowed_packet
description: The maximum size of one packet or any generated/intermediate string, or any parameter sent by the mysql_stmt_send_long_data() C API function.

name: max_binlog_cache_size
description: If a transaction requires more than this many bytes of memory, the server generates a Multi-statement transaction required more than 'max_binlog_cache_size' bytes of storage error.

name: max_binlog_size
description: If a write to the binary log causes the current log file size to exceed the value of this variable, the server rotates the binary logs (closes the current file and opens the next one).

name: max_binlog_stmt_cache_size
description: If nontransactional statements within a transaction require more than this many bytes of memory, the server generates an error.

name: max_connect_errors
description: If more than this many successive connection requests from a host are interrupted without a successful connection, the server blocks that host from further connections.

name: max_connections
description: The maximum permitted number of simultaneous client connections.

name: max_delayed_threads
description: Do not start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements.

name: max_digest_length
description: The maximum number of bytes available for computing normalized statement digests.

name: max_error_count
description: The maximum number of error, warning, and note messages to be stored for display by the SHOW ERRORS and SHOW WARNINGS statements.

name: max_execution_time
description: The execution timeout for SELECT statements, in milliseconds. If the value is 0, timeouts are not enabled.

name: max_heap_table_size
description: This variable sets the maximum size to which user-created MEMORY tables are permitted to grow.

name: max_join_size
description: Do not permit statements that probably need to examine more than max_join_size rows

name: max_length_for_sort_data
description: The cutoff on the size of index values that determines which filesort algorithm to use.

name: max_points_in_geometry
description: The maximum value of the points_per_circle argument to the ST_Buffer_Strategy() function.

name: max_prepared_stmt_count
description: This variable limits the total number of prepared statements in the server.

name: max_relay_log_size
description: The size at which the server rotates relay log files automatically. If this value is nonzero, the relay log is rotated automatically when its size exceeds this value. If this value is zero (the default), the size at which relay log rotation occurs is determined by the value of max_binlog_size.

name: max_seeks_for_key
description: Limit the assumed maximum number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key.

name: max_sort_length
description: The number of bytes to use when sorting data values.

name: max_sp_recursion_depth
description: The number of times that any given stored procedure may be called recursively. The default value for this option is 0, which completely disables recursion in stored procedures.

name: max_user_connections
description: The maximum number of simultaneous connections permitted to any given MySQL user account. A value of 0 (the default) means 'no limit.'

name: max_write_lock_count
description: After this many write locks, permit some pending read lock requests to be processed in between.

name: min_examined_row_limit
description: Can be used to cause queries which examine fewer than the stated number of rows not to be logged.

name: myisam_sort_buffer_size
description: The size of the buffer that is allocated when sorting MyISAM indexes during a REPAIR TABLE or when creating indexes with CREATE INDEX or ALTER TABLE.

name: mysql_native_password_proxy_users
description: This variable controls whether the mysql_native_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users.

name: mysqlx
description: This option controls how the server loads X Plugin at startup.

name: net_buffer_length
description: Each client thread is associated with a connection buffer and result buffer. Both begin with a size given by net_buffer_length but are dynamically enlarged up to max_allowed_packet bytes as needed.

name: net_read_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for network reading action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.

name: net_retry_count
description: If a read or write on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up.

name: net_write_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for network writing action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.

name: ngram_token_size
description: Defines the n-gram token size for the n-gram full-text parser.

name: offline_mode
description: In offline mode, clients that are refused access receive an ER_SERVER_OFFLINE_MODE error.

name: open_files_limit
description: The number of files that the operating system permits mysqld to open.

name: optimizer_prune_level
description: Controls the heuristics applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space.

name: optimizer_search_depth
description: The maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer.

name: optimizer_switch
description: The value of this variable is a set of flags, each of which has a value of on or off to indicate whether the corresponding optimizer behavior is enabled or disabled.

name: optimizer_trace
description: Controls how statements are traced.

name: optimizer_trace_features
description: Controls optimizations during statement tracing.

name: optimizer_trace_limit
description: Controls the limit on trace retention.

name: optimizer_trace_max_mem_size
description: Maximum allowed cumulated size of stored optimizer traces

name: optimizer_trace_offset
description: Controls the offset on trace retention.

name: parser_max_mem_size
description: The maximum amount of memory available to the parser.

name: partial_revokes
description: Enabling this variable makes it possible to revoke privileges partially.

name: password_history
description: This variable defines the global policy for controlling reuse of previous passwords based on required minimum number of password changes.

name: password_require_current
description: This variable defines the global policy for controlling whether attempts to change an account password must specify the current password to be replaced.

name: password_reuse_interval
description: This variable defines the global policy for controlling reuse of previous passwords based on time elapsed. For an account password used previously, this variable indicates the number of days that must pass before the password can be reused. If the value is 0 (the default), there is no reuse restriction based on time elapsed.

name: performance_schema
description: The value of this variable is ON or OFF to indicate whether the Performance Schema is enabled.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_stages_current
description: Default startup value for the events_stages_current consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_stages_history
description: Default startup value for the events_stages_history consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_stages_history_long
description: Default startup value for the events_stages_history_long consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_statements_cpu
description: Default startup value for the events_statements_cpu consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_statements_current
description: Default startup value for the events_statements_current consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_statements_history
description: Default startup value for the events_statements_history consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_statements_history_long
description: Default startup value for the events_statements_history_long consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_transactions_current
description: Default startup value for the events_transactions_current consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_transactions_history
description: Default startup value for the events_transactions_history consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_transactions_history_long
description: Default startup value for the events_transactions_history_long consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_waits_current
description: Default startup value for the events_waits_current consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_waits_history
description: Default startup value for the events_waits_history consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_events_waits_history_long
description: Default startup value for the events_waits_history_long consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_global_instrumentation
description: Default startup value for the global_instrumentation consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_statements_digest
description: Default startup value for the statements_digest consumer.

name: performance_schema_consumer_thread_instrumentation
description: Default startup value for the thread_instrumentation consumer.

name: performance_schema_instrument
description: Configure a Performance Schema instrument. The name may be given as a pattern to configure instruments that match the pattern.
