name: performance_schema_max_cond_classes
description: The maximum number of condition instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_digest_length
description: The maximum number of bytes of memory reserved per statement for computation of normalized statement digest values in the Performance Schema. This variable is related to max_digest_length.

name: performance_schema_max_file_classes
description: The maximum number of file instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_file_handles
description: The maximum number of opened file objects.

name: performance_schema_max_memory_classes
description: The maximum number of memory instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_mutex_classes
description: The maximum number of mutex instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_rwlock_classes
description: The maximum number of rwlock instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_socket_classes
description: The maximum number of socket instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_sql_text_length
description: The maximum number of bytes used to store SQL statements in the SQL_TEXT column

name: performance_schema_max_stage_classes
description: The maximum number of stage instruments.

name: performance_schema_max_statement_stack
description: The maximum depth of nested stored program calls for which the Performance Schema maintains statistics.

name: performance_schema_max_thread_classes
description: The maximum number of thread instruments.

name: persist_only_admin_x509_subject
description: Specifies the SSL certificate X.509 Subject value that users must have to be able to persist system variables that are persist-restricted.

name: persisted_globals_load
description: Whether to load persisted configuration settings from the mysqld-auto.cnf file in the data directory.

name: plugin_load
description: Tells the server to load the named plugins at startup.

name: preload_buffer_size
description: The size of the buffer that is allocated when preloading indexes.

name: print_identified_with_as_hex
description: Whether to load persisted configuration settings from the mysqld-auto.cnf file in the data directory.

name: profiling_history_size
description: The number of statements for which to maintain profiling if profiling is enabled.

name: protocol_compression_algorithms
description: The compression algorithms that the server permits for incoming connections.

name: query_alloc_block_size
description: The allocation size of memory blocks that are allocated for objects created during statement parsing and execution.

name: query_prealloc_size
description: The size of the persistent buffer used for statement parsing and execution. This buffer is not freed between statements. If you are running complex queries, a larger value might be helpful in improving performance, because it can reduce the need for the server to perform memory allocation during query execution operations.

name: range_alloc_block_size
description: The size of blocks that are allocated when doing range optimization.

name: range_optimizer_max_mem_size
description: The limit on memory consumption for the range optimizer.

name: read_buffer_size
description: Each thread that does a sequential scan allocates this buffer. Increased value may help perf if performing many sequential scans.

name: read_only
description: This parameter controls whetherthe server permits no client updates. When the server is read replica or server storage is full, this parameter will not take effect.

name: read_rnd_buffer_size
description: Avoids disk reads when reading rows in sorted order following a key-sort operation. Large values can improve ORDER BY perf.

name: regexp_stack_limit
description: The maximum available memory in bytes for the internal stack used for regular expression matching operations performed by REGEXP_LIKE() and similar functions.

name: regexp_time_limit
description: The time limit for regular expression matching operations performed by REGEXP_LIKE() and similar functions.

name: relay_log
description: Relay log path.

name: relay_log_index
description: Relay log index path.

name: relay_log_info_repository
description: This variable determines whether the slave's position in the relay logs is written to a FILE (relay-log.info) or to a TABLE (mysql.slave_relay_log_info).

name: relay_log_purge
description: Disable or enable automatic purging of relay logs as soon as they are no longer needed.

name: relay_log_recovery
description: Enables automatic relay log recovery immediately following server startup.

name: relay_log_space_limit
description: This option places an upper limit on the total size in bytes of all relay logs on the slave.

name: replicate_wild_ignore_table
description: Creates a replication filter which keeps the slave thread from replicating a statement in which any table matches the given wildcard pattern. To specify more than one table to ignore, use comma-separated list.

name: require_secure_transport
description: Whether client connections to the server are required to use some form of secure transport. When this variable is enabled, the server permits only TCP/IP connections that use SSL, or connections that use a socket file (on Unix) or shared memory (on Windows).

name: rpl_read_size
description: Controls the minimum amount of data in bytes that is read from the binary log files and relay log files.

name: rpl_stop_slave_timeout
description: In MySQL 5.6.13 and later, you can control the length of time (in seconds) that STOP SLAVE waits before timing out by setting this variable.

name: schema_definition_cache
description: Defines a limit for the number of schema definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.

name: secure_file_priv
description: This variable is used to limit the effect of data import and export operations, such as those performed by the LOAD DATA and SELECT ... INTO OUTFILE statements and the LOAD_FILE() function.

name: server_id
description: The server ID, used in replication to give each master and slave a unique identity.

name: session_track_gtids
description: Controls whether the server returns GTIDs to the client, enabling the client to use them to track the server state. Depending on the variable value, at the end of executing each transaction, the server's GTIDs are captured and returned to the client as part of the acknowledgement.

name: session_track_schema
description: Controls whether the server tracks changes to the default schema (database) name within the current session and makes this information available to the client when changes occur.

name: session_track_state_change
description: Controls whether the server tracks changes to the state of the current session and notifies the client when state changes occur.

name: session_track_system_variables
description: Controls whether the server tracks changes to the session system variables and makes this information available to the client when changes occur.

name: session_track_transaction_info
description: Track changes to the transaction attributes.

name: sha256_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys
description: Controls whether the server autogenerates RSA private/public key-pair files in the data directory.

name: sha256_password_private_key_path
description: The value of this variable is the path name of the RSA private key file for the sha256_password authentication plugin.

name: sha256_password_proxy_users
description: Controls whether the sha256_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users.

name: sha256_password_public_key_path
description: The value of this variable is the path name of the RSA public key file for the sha256_password authentication plugin.

name: show_old_temporals
description: Whether SHOW CREATE TABLE output includes comments to flag temporal columns found to be in pre-5.6.4 format.

name: skip-slave-start
description: Tells the slave server not to start the slave threads when the server starts.

name: skip_external_locking
description: Uses OS locking instead of internal

name: skip_name_resolve
description: Host names are not resolved. All Host column values in the grant tables must be IP numbers or localhost.

name: skip_show_database
description: This prevents people from using the SHOW DATABASES statement if they do not have the SHOW DATABASES privilege.

name: slave_allow_batching
description: Whether or not batched updates are enabled on replication slaves.

name: slave_checkpoint_group
description: Sets the maximum number of transactions that can be processed by a multi-threaded slave before a checkpoint operation is called to update its status as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS.

name: slave_checkpoint_period
description: Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) that is allowed to pass before a checkpoint operation is called to update the status of a multi-threaded slave as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS.

name: slave_compressed_protocol
description: Whether to use compression of the slave/master protocol if both the slave and the master support it.

name: slave_exec_mode
description: Controls how a slave thread resolves conflicts and errors during replication.

name: slave_load_tmpdir
description: The name of the directory where the slave creates temporary files.

name: slave_max_allowed_packet
description: In MySQL 5.6.6 and later, this option sets the maximum packet size in bytes for the slave SQL and I/O threads.

name: slave_net_timeout
description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from the master before the slave considers the connection broken, aborts the read, and tries to reconnect.

name: slave_parallel_type
description: The policy used to decide which transactions are allowed to execute in parallel on the slave.

name: slave_parallel_workers
description: Sets the number of slave worker threads for executing replication events (transactions) in parallel.

name: slave_pending_jobs_size_max
description: For multithreaded slaves, this variable sets the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) available to slave worker queues holding events not yet applied.

name: slave_preserve_commit_order
description: For multi-threaded slaves, enabling this variable ensures that transactions are externalized on the slave in the same order as they appear in the slave's relay log.

name: slave_rows_search_algorithms
description: When preparing batches of rows for row-based logging and replication, this variable controls how the rows are searched for matches???that is, whether or not hashing is used for searches using a primary or unique key, using some other key, or using no key at all.

name: slave_skip_errors
description: Normally, replication stops when an error occurs on the slave. This gives you the opportunity to resolve the inconsistency in the data manually.

name: slave_sql_verify_checksum
description: When this option is enabled, the slave examines checksums read from the relay log, in the event of a mismatch, the slave stops with an error.

name: slave_transaction_retries
description: If a replication slave SQL thread fails to execute a transaction because of an InnoDB deadlock or because the transaction's execution time exceeded InnoDB's innodb_lock_wait_timeout or NDB's TransactionDeadlockDetectionTimeout or TransactionInactiveTimeout, it automatically retries slave_transaction_retries times before stopping with an error.

name: slave_type_conversions
description: Controls the type conversion mode in effect on the slave when using row-based replication.

name: slow_launch_time
description: Increments Slow_launch_threads if creating thread takes longer than this many seconds.

name: slow_query_log
description: Enable or disable the slow query log

name: slow_query_log_file
description: The name of the slow query log file.

name: sort_buffer_size
description: Each session that must perform a sort allocates a buffer of this size.

name: sql_mode
description: The current server SQL mode.

name: sql_require_primary_key
description: When set, tables must be created with a primary key, and an existing primary key cannot be removed with 'ALTER TABLE'. Attempts to do so will result in an error

name: ssl_cipher
description: The list of permissible ciphers for connection encryption. By default, the FIPS cipher suites for TLS 1.2 are enforced.

name: stored_program_cache
description: Sets a soft upper limit for the number of cached stored routines per connection.

name: stored_program_definition_cache
description: Defines a limit for the number of stored program definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.

name: super_read_only
description: This parameter controls the server prohibits client updates even from users who have SUPER.

name: sync_binlog
description: The size in bytes of the buffer that InnoDB uses to write to the log files on disk.

name: sync_master_info
description: The effects of this variable on a replication slave depend on whether the slave's master_info_repository is set to FILE or TABLE

name: sync_relay_log
description: If the value of this variable is greater than 0, the MySQL server synchronizes its relay log to disk (using fdatasync()) after every sync_relay_log events are written to the relay log.

name: sync_relay_log_info
description: The effects of this variable on the slave depend on the server's relay_log_info_repository setting (FILE or TABLE), and if this is TABLE, additionally on whether the storage engine used by the relay log info table is transactional (such as InnoDB) or not (MyISAM).

name: table_definition_cache
description: The number of table definitions that can be stored in the definition cache. If you use a large number of tables, you can create a large table definition cache to speed up opening of tables. The table definition cache takes less space and does not use file descriptors, unlike the normal table cache.

name: table_encryption_privilege_check
description: Controls the TABLE_ENCRYPTION_ADMIN privilege check that occurs when creating or altering a schema or general tablespace with encryption that differs from the default_table_encryption setting, or when creating or altering a table with an encryption setting that differs from the default schema encryption.

name: table_open_cache
description: The number of open tables for all threads.

name: table_open_cache_instances
description: The number of open tables cache instances.

name: tablespace_definition_cache
description: Defines a limit for the number of tablespace definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.

name: temptable_max_ram
description: Defines the maximum amount of memory that can be occupied by the TempTable storage engine before it starts storing data on disk.

name: temptable_use_mmap
description: Defines whether the TempTable storage engine allocates space for internal in-memory temporary tables as memory-mapped temporary files when the amount of memory occupied by the TempTable storage engine exceeds the limit defined by the temptable_max_ram variable. When temptable_use_mmap is disabled, the TempTable storage engine uses InnoDB on-disk internal temporary tables instead.

name: thread_cache_size
description: How many threads the server should cache for reuse. The default value is 8 + (max_connections / 100), capped to a limit of 100.

name: thread_handling
description: The thread-handling model used by the server for connection threads.

name: thread_pool_batch_max_time
description: Maximum time for a thread to run continously (unit: us).

name: thread_pool_batch_wait_timeout
description: Maximum time for a thread to wait for socket ready (unit: us).

name: thread_pool_idle_timeout
description: Timeout in seconds for an idle thread in the thread pool. Worker thread will be shut down after timeout.

name: thread_pool_new_conn_high_prio
description: When true, new connections will be placed in the the high priority queue.

name: thread_pool_size
description: Number of thread groups in the pool. This parameter is roughly equivalent to maximum number of concurrently executing threads (threads in a waiting state do not count as executing).

name: thread_pool_stall_limit
description: Maximum query execution time in milliseconds, before an executing non-yielding thread is considered stalled. If a worker thread is stalled, additional worker thread may be created to handle remaining clients.

name: thread_stack
description: The stack size for each thread.

name: time_zone
description: The server time zone

name: tls_ciphersuites
description: Which ciphersuites the server permits for encrypted connections that use TLSv1.3.

name: tls_version
description: Which protocols the server permits for encrypted connections. By default, TLS 1.2 is enforced

name: tmp_table_size
description: The maximum size of internal in-memory temporary tables. This variable does not apply to user-created MEMORY tables.

name: tmpdir
description: The path of the directory to use for creating temporary files.

name: transaction_alloc_block_size
description: The amount in bytes by which to increase a per-transaction memory pool which needs memory.

name: transaction_isolation
description: The default transaction isolation level.

name: transaction_prealloc_size
description: There is a per-transaction memory pool from which various transaction-related allocations take memory. The initial size of the pool in bytes is transaction_prealloc_size.

name: transaction_read_only
description: The transaction access mode. The value can be OFF (read/write; the default) or ON (read only).

name: transaction_write_set_extraction
description: Defines the algorithm used to generate a hash identifying the writes associated with a transaction.

name: updatable_views_with_limit
description: This variable controls whether updates to a view can be made when the view does not contain all columns of the primary key defined in the underlying table, if the update statement contains a LIMIT clause.

name: validate_user_plugins
description: Turns on additional validation of authentication plugins assigned to user accounts.

name: wait_timeout
description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.

name: windowing_use_high_precision
description: Whether to compute window operations without loss of precision.
